intro: Leandra glabrata, commonly known as the smooth leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it an attractive ornamental species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and wetlands.
